ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to read introductory Zen texts and write insightful responses to various Zen authors.
learned a lot about zen buddhism

We learned chiefly about Zen Buddhism, but also the schools of thought that gave rise to it, and its application in the modern world. I learned how to think critically about historical pieces of writing, not just to accept them as gospel. For the first time at Yale the class also encouraged using the resources in Sterling and finding sources myself without relying on a professor.
I learned so much about Zen Buddhism and Asian history
Critical reading analysis and argumentative writing skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really liked the class, but sometimes the readings were upwards of 200 pages as well as an essay, which was a bit tricky.
learned so much and the professor really cares! a lot of reading and the weekly essays are challenging, but if you want to learn its worth it
No weaknesses, it was a great class.
Its a workload heavy course. You write an essay every week. But genuinely so so engaging and intellectually fulfilling.
Engaging throughout, weekly reading response ensured class discussions were thoughtful and informed each week. Long essay at the end with freedom to choose the topic was very engaging.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! The Professor is great and the course material is very interesting.
yes if theyre ready for the work

Yes, absolutely if you are engaged with the subject area. There is a lot of reading, which is all very relevant and hand picked for learning. There is no way to get around this reading, it will be shown in section. Furthermore, there is a substantial amount of primary reading, which can be a little challenging and dry given its primary nature.
Yes highly so. Such an amazing class one of the best ive ever taken. But theres a good amount of homework be aware.
I would absolutely recommend this course to those who have an existing interest in the topic.
